headline.main: HULL SEES HITLER WARNING GERMANS; Speech Indicates 'Desperate' Effort to Prepare Nazis for More Hardships, He Holds NEUTRAL PRESS CAUTIOUS British Interpret the Talk as Meaning Reich Will Go on Defensive Against Invasion

lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct. 1 -- In remarking today that Adolf Hitler's speech yesterday contained less than the usual "boasts and bombast" and indicated that "he is desperately preparing his people for still greater hardships," Cordell Hull, Secretary of State, expressed what appeared to be the prevailing view here in military as well as political circles.
